private_information: Available actions with their informal schemas and arities: paltry(object_0,object_1,object_2), sip(object_0,object_1,object_2), clip(object_0,object_1,object_2), wretched(object_0,object_1,object_2,object_3), memory(object_0,object_1,object_2), tightfisted(object_0,object_1,object_2).

Action constraints summary: paltry requires hand(o0), cats(o1), texture(o2), vase(o0,o1), next(o1,o2). paltry makes next(o0,o2) true and makes vase(o0,o1) false. sip requires hand(o0), cats(o1), texture(o2), next(o0,o2), next(o1,o2). sip makes vase(o0,o1) true and makes next(o0,o2) false. clip requires hand(o0), sneeze(o1), texture(o2), next(o1,o2), next(o0,o2). clip makes vase(o0,o1) true and makes next(o0,o2) false. wretched requires sneeze(o0), texture(o1), texture(o2), stupendous(o3), next(o0,o1), collect(o1,o3), collect(o2,o3). wretched makes next(o0,o2) true and makes next(o0,o1) false. memory requires cats(o0), spring(o1), spring(o2), next(o0,o1). memory makes next(o0,o2) true and makes next(o0,o1) false. tightfisted requires hand(o0), sneeze(o1), texture(o2), next(o1,o2), vase(o0,o1). tightfisted makes next(o0,o2) true and makes vase(o0,o1) false.
Two provided scenario statements with initial facts sets, goals, and proposed plans exist.
player.goal: Analyze and annotate the action schemas, the provided initial states, and the proposed plans to produce a clear structured summary of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects. Identify required but missing facts from the plans.

Statement A goal: next object_12 object_11.
Statement A plan: wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3; clip object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_11.

Statement B initial facts include cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.

observer.goal: Extract formal lists of initial predicates and explicit goals from both statements and produce a compact canonical representation of the world objects, predicates, and goals for downstream integration.

private_information: Audit remit: verify temporal and causal consistency of multi-step plans, detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as artificial tokens, quota tokens, or post-hoc penalties, and flag any steps that rely on unstated ephemeral bookkeeping facts.
Audit constraints: prefer minimal adjustments to the domain and problem that preserve intended semantics while eliminating bookkeeping shortcuts.
auditor.goal: Produce a causal and temporal audit report that identifies ordering conflicts, missing preconditions, redundant bookkeeping predicates, and recommendations to normalize the domain so that resulting PDDL does not rely on ephemeral bookkeeping shortcuts.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the analyses, facts, and audit recommendations and produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that represents the actions and goals from the provided scenarios. Keep agent actions distinct and label them if needed.

public_information: This environment contains object tokens named object_0 through object_12 and predicates such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous.
Action templates and their intended preconditions and effects are explained in agent private_information entries.

Two scenario statements were provided. Scenario A has an initial fact set, a goal next object_12 object_11, and a proposed plan of four actions. Scenario B has an initial fact set and the goals next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5. Scenario B plan was not provided in the text.
The orchestrator will synthesize the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards after receiving analysis, facts, and audit reports from other agents.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the player agent. Your role is to examine the informal action descriptions, plan steps, and scenario statements. Produce a structured analysis that for each action lists its parameter variables, explicit preconditions, add effects and delete effects. Highlight where a plan step requires a predicate that is not present in the supplied initial facts. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise machine readable summary suitable for the orchestrator.
analyze.prompt: Analyze the provided actions paltry sip clip wretched memory tightfisted and the two scenario plans and initial fact sets. Produce a clear structured summary of preconditions and effects and list missing or ambiguous facts.

extract.system_prompt: You are the observer agent. Your role is to extract and canonicalize the initial predicates, the object set, and the explicit goals from the two statements. Represent predicates as predicate(objectX,objectY) forms and provide a compact object list. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a canonical fact list suitable for the orchestrator.
extract.prompt: Parse both STATEMENT blocks and return canonical lists of initial predicates, objects, and goals. If a plan is provided, list the plan steps in order.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor agent. Your role is to check temporal and causal consistency of the proposed plans and to identify bookkeeping shortcuts such as ephemeral tokens or post hoc penalty facts. Recommend concrete normalizations to remove bookkeeping shortcuts and produce an ordering and causal dependency report. Do not emit PDDL. The report must be actionable and precise for the orchestrator to apply changes.
audit.prompt: Review the structured analysis and extracted facts if available. Produce an audit that lists conflicts, missing preconditions that break causal chains, redundant predicates used only for bookkeeping, and concrete normalization suggestions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator agent responsible for producing the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem tailored to the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the players analysis, observer facts, and auditor recommendations. Keep actions distinct when multiple agents could perform similar effects. The PDDL domain and problem must be complete, parsable by FastDownwards, and should avoid ephemeral bookkeeping predicates by applying the auditor recommendations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility and include typing only if compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Using the analysis, extracted facts, and audit report provided, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the scenario. Ensure the domain defines all predicates seen in the facts and the actions with correct preconditions and effects. Ensure the problem lists all objects, initial state predicates, and the declared goals. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include additional commentary.
